Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2010 09:46PM Dennis wrote: The survival rate for stage 1 is 100% in five year. In your case, your outcome should be very good. When my wife went for Chemo back in 2008, she met a lady who was stage 1 back in 2005. No Chemo.  Cancer came back 2 times. I know it is a personal choice.  Losing hair is a minor thing. Chemo + Herceptin works very good. My wife is without cancer for 3 years now. She doesn't think too many of the disease now. We are planning for our vacation in a few month.
Posts.Title: Deciding Against Chemo JudyAnnW Titan

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2009 12:39PM Dennis wrote: Thanks you all for the info, My wife has no rash, after taking the medicine, the pain went away. She didn't take the medicine yesterday and today. She still has itching on the chest on the scar.

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2009 09:36PM Dennis wrote: Went to see her doctor today. He said it is not lymphedema. He gave her 15mg Meloxicam (anti-inflammatory), ordered an X-ray for the arm. Because the pain is in the muscle, He thinks it is arthritis and being over 45.

Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2009 10:58PM Dennis wrote: Just recieved the doctor report. X-ray came back Okay,  Kind of relief. Her pain went away. She managed to run 10K with me on Sunday. Big finish for a long time. Herceptin did weaken her a bit.

Is exercising the only option?  The doc said don't sleep on the side that she operated on. Maybe she should take some Tylenol.
